itemDescription: Doctor active in family planning; right-to-die campaigner

wikipedia_page.main: Elizabeth Stanfield Bell Wilson (3 June 1926 – 29 March 2016) was a family planning physician and right to die campaigner. She founded the 408 Clinic, a women's health centre in Sheffield, and was a founder member of FATE (Friends at the End), an organisation lobby for a change in legislation to allow assisted dying. In 2009, she was arrested by police in Surrey on suspicion of advising a woman who had advanced multiple sclerosis on how to end her life.

response: Elizabeth Wilson (1921–2015) was an American actress.
Elizabeth Wilson (or variants) may also refer to:
*Elizabeth Wilson (author) (born 1936), feminist independent researcher and writer
*Elizabeth Wilson (doctor) (1926–2016), family planning physician and right to die campaigner
